alert.note: Alert for Kennebec (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 02 at 12:02PM EDT until May 04 at 11:30AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warnings continues for the following rivers in Maine... Kennebec River at Hallowell affecting Kennebec and Sagadahoc Counties. Kennebec River At North Sidney affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River At Augusta affecting Kennebec County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Maine... Kennebec River At Skowhegan affecting Kennebec and Somerset Counties. For the Kennebec River...including Skowhegan, North Sidney, Augusta, Hallowell...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kennebec River at Augusta. * WHEN...Until late Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Water reaches the back of some buildings on Water Street in Augusta. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 20.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:30 AM EDT Tuesday was 20.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
